SIR, 
"APPLICATION FOR THE RELEASE AND SUBSEQUENT TRANSFER OF MY INHERITED FUNDS OF

your client who held the above account number  
and who died in 2006
I discovered the above account details in my late  
brother's private bedroom in  and as his next  
of kin, I humbly appeal to your honoured office to

transaction rules and regulations. 
Thanks Yours 
sincerely. 
................ 
XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX



call me +22678161909
 
your share is 25 percent of the entire funds

the end :)

 




scamorama main street

get booked

messages.subject: URGENT RESPONSE NEEDED
messages.body:
ATTN SIR
 
I am writing to seek your partnership in the investment of my inheritance fund USD$17.5M from my late father who died mysteriously last Dec. It was very evident that he was poisoned to death. In my culture, when a man dies, if he does not have a male child, the brothers shares his property leaving both the wife and the daughters empty handed including the house they live in. This is the exact case with me as I am the only daughter of my father. I lost my mother when I was barely a year old and my father refused to re-marry another wife because he felt solely responsible for my mother's death. This is so because he concentrated much on his businesses that he rarely pays attention to domestic affairs. 

 
He was always travelling taking care of his businesses that he did not notice when my mother took ill. He thought it was a minor illness and was ignorant of this. My mother on her own resorted to self-medication. It was not until the illness degenerated that my father took my mother to hospital where she was diagnosed to find out that hypatitis had eaten deep into her blood stream. She didn't last long before she died. This happened when I was barely a year old. Based on this, my father could not forgive himself easily because of it and said he was responsible for her death as he could have saved her if only he had paid attention to the things at home rather than concentrating much on his businesses.
 
Despite all entreaties by friends and relatives, he refused to remarry but ensured that I had everything that I wanted. It was as a result of this that he made me the next of kin to his fund deposit with the bank and stated that in the event of any eventuality, I should have a direct access to the fund only when I am 24 years of age otherwise, I should have a guardian/partner intercede on my behalf for the release of the funds to me. Unfortunately, he died late last year and I am 21 years of age currently. 
 
This is why I have contacted you to serve as a guardian to me and as my foreign partner for the investment of the fund overseas My uncles does not know about the fund because they had already taken my father's houses and other properties because I am a girl and they said I do not have rights for any property. They have requested to have my father's bank papers but I simply told them that I do not know where he kept them. The younger brother took the house in the village while the houses in the town were sold out they shared the proceed they got from the sale. Right now, I am with a friend of mine and do sincerely want to travel out of my country. This can only happen when I have secured the release and transfer of the funds in the bank. This why it is important that we have a plan on the type of lucrative business that we can invest the funds on. I had at various times had discussions with the director of international remittance unit of the bank where my father deposited the funds and

I was assured that once, I have someone who would be willing to receive the funds on my behalf, they shall commence all proceedings to effect the release and transfer of the funds into the person's designated account. Now, that you have signified your interest to partner with me, it would only be very necessary if you contact the bank and request for the release and transfer of my inheritance fund into your nominated account for the purpose of investment and to further have me come over to your country to continue with my studies. I shall be giving you the bank's contact details as soon as I hear 
back from you so that you will go ahead and contact the bank.

Thanks
 
Yours
 
Bridget Manu
messages.raw:
Bridget Manu
Reply-To: <bridgetmanu111@yahoo.fr>
From: bridget manu <bridget_manu01@hotmail.fr>
Subject: URGENT RESPONSE NEEDED
Date: Tue, 16 Oct 2007

ATTN SIR

I am writing to seek your partnership in the investment of my inheritance fund USD$17.5M from my late father who died mysteriously last Dec. It was very evident that he was poisoned to death. In my culture, when a man dies, if he does not have a male child, the brothers shares his property leaving both the wife and the daughters empty handed including the house they live in. This is the exact case with me as I am the only daughter of my father. I lost my mother when I was barely a year old and my father refused to re-marry another wife because he felt solely responsible for my mother's death. This is so because he concentrated much on his businesses that he rarely pays attention to domestic affairs.

He was always travelling taking care of his businesses that he did not notice when my mother took ill. He thought it was a minor illness and was ignorant of this. My mother on her own resorted to self-medication. It was not until the illness degenerated that my father took my mother to hospital where she was diagnosed to find out that hypatitis had eaten deep into her blood stream. She didn't last long before she died. This happened when I was barely a year old. Based on this, my father could not forgive himself easily because of it and said he was responsible for her death as he could have saved her if only he had paid attention to the things at home rather than concentrating much on his businesses.

Despite all entreaties by friends and relatives, he refused to remarry but ensured that I had everything that I wanted. It was as a result of this that he made me the next of kin to his fund deposit with the bank and stated that in the event of any eventuality, I should have a direct access to the fund only when I am 24 years of age otherwise, I should have a guardian/partner intercede on my behalf for the release of the funds to me. Unfortunately, he died late last year and I am 21 years of age currently.

This is why I have contacted you to serve as a guardian to me and as my foreign partner for the investment of the fund overseas My uncles does not know about the fund because they had already taken my father's houses and other properties because I am a girl and they said I do not have rights for any property. They have requested to have my father's bank papers but I simply told them that I do not know where he kept them. The younger brother took the house in the village while the houses in the town were sold out they shared the proceed they got from the sale. Right now, I am with a friend of mine and do sincerely want to travel out of my country. This can only happen when I have secured the release and transfer of the funds in the bank. This why it is important that we have a plan on the type of lucrative business that we can invest the funds on. I had at various times had discussions with the director of international remittance unit of the bank where my father deposited the funds and

I was assured that once, I have someone who would be willing to receive the funds on my behalf, they shall commence all proceedings to effect the release and transfer of the funds into the person's designated account. Now, that you have signified your interest to partner with me, it would only be very necessary if you contact the bank and request for the release and transfer of my inheritance fund into your nominated account for the purpose of investment and to further have me come over to your country to continue with my studies. I shall be giving you the bank's contact details as soon as I hear back from you so that you will go ahead and contact the bank.

Thanks
Yours
Bridget Manu

messages.body:
My Dear Bridge


Your email touched me deeply as I feel the same way about my wife who died while I was always away on duty. I am only 40 but feel that I cannot look for new love. I feel your pain my dear.
How can I help you and perhaps I will receive some consolation from my act

Captain Sir George Manwairing
messages.raw:
Capt. Sir George Manwairing
Date: Wed, 17 Oct 2007
To: bridgetmanu111@yahoo.fr

My Dear Bridge

Your email touched me deeply as I feel the same way about my wife who died while I was always away on duty. I am only 40 but feel that I cannot look for new love. I feel your pain my dear.
How can I help you and perhaps I will receive some consolation from my act

Captain Sir George Manwairing

messages.subject: application///call me
messages.body:
Dear Captain
 
Note, before i contacted you i have made every arrangement that will lead to the success of this transaction you only apply to this bank as the next of kin to this deceased customer i am here to be giving you every information that will encaurage you till the end of this transaction. 
Now your duty is to agree with me and provide an account where this fund will be transfered to in our favour do not entertain any fear atll, because if this will bring problem i would have not caontact you due to it will effect me. just be free minded we are going to achieve this airm only if you can follow my instructions accordingly. 
Here is the text of application just apply to the bank through their email address which is adbank_bf@laposte.net
Please apply immediately and contact me so that i will be monitoring it to be giving you a successful information. please you can call me because i cannot call you from the office for them not to know my discaussion with you, i hope you will understand me. 
best regards,

Bridget

we are extremely committed to consumating the deal with you so feeel very free to send the application to the bank and send a copy to me
thanks 
 
Bridget

messages.body:
Dear Bridge


Your sudden change of tone suprises me. To begin you were very forthcoming with your feelings and worries and now you sound like some businessman doing a deal. What has happened to you?.
I am currently on a posting and am unable to make a phone call and only have a limited amount of free time where I can use the computer. Im sure you appreciate that the country I am is very volatile which makes things difficult.

I have sent the form to the bank as you instruct.

Do you have a photo that you can send a lonely soldier?

Best wishes

Capt. M
messages.raw:
Capt. Sir George Manwairing
Date: Thu, 18 Oct 2007
To: bridget manu <bridgetmanu111@yahoo.fr>

Dear Bridge

Your sudden change of tone suprises me. To begin you were very forthcoming with your feelings and worries and now you sound like some businessman doing a deal. What has happened to you?. I am currently on a posting and am unable to make a phone call and only have a limited amount of free time where I can use the computer. Im sure you appreciate that the country I am is very volatile which makes things difficult.

I have sent the form to the bank as you instruct.

Do you have a photo that you can send a lonely soldier?

Best wishes

Capt. M

warmest regards

Cap.

messages.body:
My Dear Bridge


I am about to go on patrol, its nearly 3pm here and I wont be back for about 48 hours. I hope there is a nice photo of you waiting for me. It gives me something to look forward to while I am on patrol

Talk soon

Cap.

messages.subject: MY PICTURE
messages.body:
Dear captain
 
Thanks for your mail, i wish you God guidance in your patrol.
 
Please do not fail to send me mail often even if i have not meet with you but i know that if it is the wish of God to help me out of this my predicament i will for ever be grateful to you and God who has not allowed me to die in the hands of the oppressors.
 
Do not forget to let me know about your communication with the bank, i hope the bank will release the money to you.because i want to leave here immediately the bank release the money to you if not if my family get to know that i have the money i will be in trouble and i do not want to die sudden like my parents.
 
Kindly reassure me that you will not disappoint or sit on the money  because that is the only hope i have for life.  I will like to hear your voice on phone, you can go to the public phone and call me so that i will express myself better.
 
This is my picture, i will like to see yours too, when next i receive your mail i will send to you my parents picture.
 
waiting to hear goodnews from you.
 
 
Lonely Bridget
messages.raw:
Bridget Manu
Date: Fri, 19 Oct 2007
From: bridget manu <bridgetmanu111@yahoo.fr>
Subject: MY PICTURE

Dear captain

Thanks for your mail, i wish you God guidance in your patrol.

Please do not fail to send me mail often even if i have not meet with you but i know that if it is the wish of God to help me out of this my predicament i will for ever be grateful to you and God who has not allowed me to die in the hands of the oppressors.

Do not forget to let me know about your communication with the bank, i hope the bank will release the money to you.because i want to leave here immediately the bank release the money to you if not if my family get to know that i have the money i will be in trouble and i do not want to die sudden like my parents.

Kindly reassure me that you will not disappoint or sit on the money because that is the only hope i have for life. I will like to hear your voice on phone, you can go to the public phone and call me so that i will express myself better.

This is my picture, i will like to see yours too, when next i receive your mail i will send to you my parents picture.

waiting to hear goodnews from you.

Lonely Bridget

[aahh.. she is lonely now. She did send a picture but its a standard stock one...AND then I went away for a week... nice...but she got a bit pissed...]

messages.subject: I AM IN DILEMA
messages.body:
Dear,
 
I hope your work is not too tedious during the last week end. Have you seen the picture i sent to you and my number.  I expect you to call me in order to discuss  well.
 
During the last week end my father family came to trouble me at where i am hidding because it seems that they are suspecting that i have contacted somebody who is willing to help me out of this my predicament, please do not response to anybody because they knew quite alright that i want to seek for assistance.  If eventually you help me claim this money i will forever be grateful to you and your family for not allowing me to die in the hands of the operassors.
 
Please let me know now the process in the bank or if i receive your mail i will go to the bank to know what is happening, do not entertain any fear it is my father's money, the bank have no right to delay it of what so ever reason.
 
Waiting to hear goodnews from you today.
 
Bridget.
00226 78 03 66 93

Bridget Manu
Date: Mon, 22 Oct 2007
From: bridget manu <bridgetmanu111@yahoo.fr>
Subject: I AM IN DILEMA

Bridget.

[So now I am only dear,. This relationship wont last]

messages.body:
From Captain Manwairing Mon Oct 29 11:03:32 2007



My Darling Bridget

Unfortunately my patrol was hit by a roadside bomb and I have been in hospital with concussion and terminal tinitus. I am sorry that I have not been able to reply to your mail, but you should not feel any problems as our communication is 100% risk free.
I have your photo and you are indeed a hot chick. As a poor soldier what about somehting a little bit more saucy to keep me going while I recouperate

Cant wait to hear from you

Cap.
messages.raw:
Capt. Sir George Manwairing
From Captain Manwairing Mon Oct 29 11:03:32 2007
Date: Mon, 29 Oct 2007
My Darling Bridget

Unfortunately my patrol was hit by a roadside bomb and I have been in hospital with concussion and terminal tinitus. I am sorry that I have not been able to reply to your mail, but you should not feel any problems as our communication is 100% risk free.
I have your photo and you are indeed a hot chick. As a poor soldier what about somehting a little bit more saucy to keep me going while I recouperate

Cant wait to hear from you

Cap.

messages.body:
Dear Captain,
 
Thank for your mail and i wish you quick recovery.
 
If you can manage your self and send the letter to the bank in order for them to start processing it i will appreciate it because the more it stay there again we will be charge  for more interest.
 
Immediately you send it please call me  so that i will have rest of mind here.
 
I am still expecting your personal picture if possible go to the public phone and call me.
 
Bridget.
messages.raw:
Bridget Manu
Date: Mon, 29 Oct 2007

Dear Captain,

Thank for your mail and i wish you quick recovery.

If you can manage your self and send the letter to the bank in order for them to start processing it i will appreciate it because the more it stay there again we will be charge for more interest.

Immediately you send it please call me so that i will have rest of mind here.

I am still expecting your personal picture if possible go to the public phone and call me.

Bridget.

messages.body:
My Dear Bridge

Please find enclosed a picture of me for you. I dont have any pictures as such and so got my batman to take this of me last night.
I have also sent the mail to the bank as you have requested. I am unable to call you at all. Im sure you can appreciate that we dont have public phones in the camp and all communication outside is forbidden other than emails which are all read and stored before sending for security. I hope you understand. I will be on leave in the next month or so and will be able to call you then as I will or at least hope to be, home for xmas.
Do you have any more revealing pictures of yourself to keep me company on my lonely patrols?

Always yours

Captain M
messages.raw:
Capt. Sir George Manwairing
Date: Tue, 30 Oct 2007
My Dear Bridge

Please find enclosed a picture of me for you. I dont have any pictures as such and so got my batman to take this of me last night.
I have also sent the mail to the bank as you have requested. I am unable to call you at all. Im sure you can appreciate that we dont have public phones in the camp and all communication outside is forbidden other than emails which are all read and stored before sending for security. I hope you understand. I will be on leave in the next month or so and will be able to call you then as I will or at least hope to be, home for xmas.
Do you have any more revealing pictures of yourself to keep me company on my lonely patrols?

Always yours

Captain M

[Just some chap from google who was in a uniform and in the desert... quite handsome though.. like me of course!]

messages.body:
Dear captain,
 
how are you i saw your picture.
I do not have any rest of mind here because of my family, please hasten up so that the money can get to you quickly and i may join you uptown if you wishes because i have to continue with my education so that my future will be bright.
 
Please send the copy of the letter you sent so that i will ask my late father lawyer to follow up. i could have replied you since yesterday it is difficult for me to get money to go to cyber cafe.
 
i do not have money to scan the other picture to you for now, please do not be offended.
 
reply me urgently.
 
Bridget

messages.body:
Oct 31 

 
My Dear Birdget

Call me George, Captain is very formal.

What is it exactly you want me to hasten up? I am currently waiting for the bank to reply to my mail so its pretty much out of my hands now really.

Here is another copy but as the bank now has it, I cant see what good you having a copy will do


ATTN: ALHAJI ABU TRAORE, 
FOREIGN REMMITTANCE DIRECTOR, 
AFRICA DEVELOPMENT BANK (ADB), 
OUAGADOUGOU,BURKINA FASO.
SIR, 
"APPLICATION FOR THE RELEASE AND SUBSEQUENT TRANSFER OF MY INHERITED FUNDS OF 
( US$17.5 MILLION DOLLARS) FROM ACCOUNT NO, 2627578-2341 
I,am the cousin and next of kin to late MR MANU
your client who held the above account number 
and who died in 2006
I discovered the above account details in my late 
brother's private bedroom in  and as his next 
of kin, I humbly appeal to your honoured office to 
release and transfer this money in to my receiving bank account details below. 
(1)my bank name is HSBC
(2)my bank address is Wimbledon High Street, Wimbledon
(3)my bank account number 965554201
(4)my bank telephone and fax number No idea but can probably get them if its really that important
(5)my personal 
address 69 Lower Spunker Street, Hidden Cottaging, Hampstead Heath.
(6)my personal telephone and fax numbers +44 70054551122
(7)my private email address is This one
(8)my occupation Serving Army Captain

I shall appreciate your prompt attention to this my 
application as I promise to abide by all your 
transaction rules and regulations.. 
Thanks Yours 
sincerely. 

Captain Sir George Manwairing



I hope to see a picture of you soon. I hope you found my picture attractive. Life can be very boring while on this posting so please do hurry and get me some "revealing" picture of you for me to look at while Im alone in my bed at night. You are so very sexy

Write soon

All my love George

XX

Thu Nov  1
 
Dear George,
 
I have read your last mail and i think i did not see anything that is serious out of it.
 
Let me tell you if not that i lost my father i will not look for any help from you neither i can travel to any part of the world with the help and influence of my father.
 
I am not an harlort, i was brought up in a good christian life and i can never, never i say expose myself for postures in any way.
 
So please leave me to my faith as you are not ready to help me because i and the lawyer went to the bank it was a different story we met there.
 
Thank you and God bless you for deceiving me..
 
Bridget

I think I should remind you that you contacted me and at no point did you ask for me to pay your internet fees, in fact you were very keen to send me millions of dollars. I have to say that as a mugu 419 scammer, you are not very adept. You should listen well well and perhaps get a new job because you are rubbish at this one, you are the bottom pot.

I await your denial?

Cap
